Only average is available for durations: Only average is available for durations
Type of measurement to show in graphs.
Log type to query. A conversation is an: Log type to query. A conversation is an aggregation of flows between same peers. Only ended conversations will appear in Overview and Topology tabs.
Only available when FlowCollector.proces: Only available when FlowCollector.processor.logTypes option equals "CONNECTIONS", "ENDED_CONNECTIONS" or "ALL"
Only available when FlowCollector.processor.logTypes option equals "FLOWS" or "ALL"
A flow might be reported from several in: A flow might be reported from several interfaces, and from both source and destination nodes, making it appear several times. By default, duplicates are hidden. Showing duplicates is not possible in Overview and Topology tabs to avoid altering metric calculations. Use the Direction filter to switch between ingress, egress and inner-node traffic.
Whether each query result has to match a: Whether each query result has to match all the filters or just any of them
Filter flows by their drop status. Only: Filter flows by their drop status. Only packets dropped by the kernel are monitored here.
Fully dropped shows the flows that are 1: Fully dropped shows the flows that are 100% dropped
Containing drops shows the flows having: Containing drops shows the flows having at least one packet dropped
Without drops show the flows having 0% d: Without drops show the flows having 0% dropped
Only available using eBPF with FlowColle: Only available using eBPF with FlowCollector.agent.ebpf.enablePktDrop option equals "true"
Top items for internal backend queries.
Depending on the matching and filter set: Depending on the matching and filter settings, several queries can be performed under the cover, each with this parameter set, resulting in more results after aggregation.
Force table rows to specific sizing.
Measurement to show as edge labels.
Grouping items helps to better understan: Grouping items helps to better understand ownership.
The way in which topology items are arra: The way in which topology items are arranged.
Various options to show / hide view deta: Various options to show / hide view details.
Switch between one way / back and forth: Switch between one way / back and forth filtering
One way shows traffic strictly as define: One way shows traffic strictly as defined per your filters
Back and forth shows traffic according t: Back and forth shows traffic according to your filters, plus the related return traffic
Loki '/ready' endpoint returned the foll: Loki '/ready' endpoint returned the following error
You may consider the following query cha: You may consider the following query changes to avoid this error
Check if Loki is running correctly. '/re: Check if Loki is running correctly. '/ready' endpoint should respond "ready"
Reduce the Query Options -> limit to red: Reduce the Query Options -> limit to reduce the number of results
Increase Loki \"max_entries_limit_per_qu: Increase Loki "max_entries_limit_per_query" entry in configuration file
Add Namespace, Owner or Resource filters: Add Namespace, Owner or Resource filters (which use indexed fields) to improve the query performance
Reduce limit and time range to decrease: Reduce limit and time range to decrease the number of results
Increase time step to decrease the numbe: Increase time step to decrease the number of parallel queries
Ensure Loki config contains \"parallelis: Ensure Loki config contains "parallelise_shardable_queries: true" and "max_outstanding_requests_per_tenant: 2048"
Reduce the time range to decrease the nu: Reduce the time range to decrease the number of results
Increase Loki \"max_query_length\" entry: Increase Loki "max_query_length" entry in configuration file
Zoom in / zoom out the histogram display: Zoom in / zoom out the histogram displayed time range. The selected time range in the top right corner will adapt accordingly. You can also use the plus or minus buttons while the histogram is focused.
Move the selected range to filter the ta: Move the selected range to filter the table below as time based pagination. You can also use the page up or down buttons while the histogram is focused.
Shift the histogram displayed time range: Shift the histogram displayed time range. The selected time range in the top right corner will adapt accordingly. You can also use the arrow left or right buttons while the histogram is focused.
The following bar chart represents the n: The following bar chart represents the number of logs over time. You can select a portion of it to drill down into the selected time range, accordingly/consequently filtering the following flows information.
No datapoints found in the selected time: No datapoints found in the selected time range
Reset time range and try again.
Selected columns will appear in the tabl: Selected columns will appear in the table.
Click and drag the items to reorder the: Click and drag the items to reorder the columns in the table.
At least one column must be selected: At least one column must be selected
Following query will be exported as CSV: Following query will be exported as CSV format:
Use this option to export every fields a: Use this option to export every fields and labels from flows.
Selected panels will appear in the overv: Selected panels will appear in the overview tab.
Click and drag the items to reorder the: Click and drag the items to reorder the panels in the overview tab.
At least one panel must be selected: At least one panel must be selected
From date cannot be in the future: From date cannot be in the future
To date must be after From date: To date must be after From date
Select a custom time range. Flows are se: Select a custom time range. Flows are selected based on their End Time value.
Clear or reset filters and try again.
Show total traffic for the selected filt: Show total traffic for the selected filters
Show other traffic grouped in a separate: Show other traffic grouped in a separate series
Show NoError responses grouped in a sepa: Show NoError responses grouped in a separate series
Show scope-internal traffic, depending o: Show scope-internal traffic, depending on the selected scope (e.g. node-internal traffic, namespace-internal traffic)
Show out of scope traffic (e.g. host-net: Show out of scope traffic (e.g. host-network traffic when scope is different from "Node")
Compare to total dropped instead of tota: Compare to total dropped instead of total sent.
ICMP type provided but protocol is {{pro: ICMP type provided but protocol is {{proto}}
ICMP code provided but protocol is {{pro: ICMP code provided but protocol is {{proto}}
Name: Name
No information available for this conten: No information available for this content. Change scope to get more details.
When in \"Match any\" mode, try using on: When in "Match any" mode, try using only Namespace, Owner or Resource filters (which use indexed fields), or decrease limit / range, to improve the query performance
Add Namespace, Owner or Resource filters: Add Namespace, Owner or Resource filters (which use indexed fields), or decrease limit / range, to improve the query performance
Add more filters or decrease limit / ran: Add more filters or decrease limit / range to improve the query performance
Filtered sum of top-k bytes / filtered t: Filtered sum of top-k bytes / filtered total bytes
Filtered top-k byte rate / filtered tota: Filtered top-k byte rate / filtered total byte rate
Filtered sum of top-k packets / filtered: Filtered sum of top-k packets / filtered total packets
Filtered avg RTT / filtered total avg RT: Filtered avg RTT / filtered total avg RTT
Flow per request limit reached, followin: Flow per request limit reached, following metrics can be inaccurate. Narrow down your search or increase limit.
Incomplete resource name, either kind, n: Incomplete resource name, either kind, namespace or name is missing.
Namespace: not a valid Kubernetes name: Namespace: not a valid Kubernetes name
Name: not a valid Kubernetes name: Name: not a valid Kubernetes name
Not a valid IPv4 or IPv6, nor a CIDR, no: Not a valid IPv4 or IPv6, nor a CIDR, nor an IP range separated by hyphen
The top rates as bar compared to total a: The top rates as bar compared to total as line over the selected interval
The average rate over the selected inter: The average rate over the selected interval
The last measured rate from the selected: The last measured rate from the selected interval
The top dropped states (dropped by the k: The top dropped states (dropped by the kernel) over the selected interval
The top drop causes (dropped by the kern: The top drop causes (dropped by the kernel) over the selected interval
Top {{limit}} {{type}} dropped rates sta: Top {{limit}} {{type}} dropped rates stacked with total
The top dropped rates (dropped by the ke: The top dropped rates (dropped by the kernel) as bar compared to total as line over the selected interval
The average DNS latencies over the selec: The average DNS latencies over the selected interval
The average TCP handshake Round Trip Tim: The average TCP handshake Round Trip Time over the selected interval
The top DNS response code extracted from: The top DNS response code extracted from DNS response headers over the selected interval
Top {{limit}} DNS response code stacked: Top {{limit}} DNS response code stacked with total
The top DNS response code as bar compare: The top DNS response code as bar compared to total as line over the selected interval
